title: Open Wound Treatment and Cleaning
brief: How to clean and dress open wounds to prevent infection in survival situations.
steps: Remove or cut clothing away from the wound.
Look for exit wound if caused by sharp object, gunshot, or projectile.
Thoroughly clean skin around the wound.
Rinse (do not scrub) wound with large amounts of water under pressure.
Use fresh urine if water is not available for rinsing.
Leave wound open for drainage - do not attempt to suture closed.
Cover with clean dressing and secure with bandage.
Change dressing daily to check for infection.
For gaping wounds, bring edges together with butterfly-shaped adhesive tape.
warnings: Never try to close wounds by suturing in survival situations
Open treatment allows drainage and prevents life-threatening infections
Always check for exit wounds with penetrating injuries
